About Me üëã

Hello! I'm James (also capjamesg). My pronouns are he/him/his. This is my blog.

I like to brew coffee at home. I usually use the Aeropress, V60, Chemex, or Kalita Wave to brew my coffee.

On this blog, I share my thoughts on all things coffee and I interview people who work in coffee, with a particular emphasis on the Scottish coffee industry.

I sometimes write about websites and web development.

My email address is readers@jamesg.blog (public key for encryption). I sometimes post on Instagram.

I also contribute to the IndieWeb wiki. I have open sourced some code on GitHub.

  • Programming, cooking, and making what you want to use

    Published on January 14, 2022 under the IndieWeb category.

    I just read a delightful blog post called "An app can be a home-cooked meal". The author of the post, Robin, shares his story of making a personal messaging app just for him and his close family. The messaging app doesn't aim to do much other than let them communicate in a way they feel is natural. There are no ads, forced updates, or anything of that nature to worry about. Because Robin made the app himself, he chooses its direction.
